page.title: 10Rail Transport
page.content: The Grantham to Nottingham railway line runs from East to West through the D block. On the line is a signal box. The man operating the box has worked for British Rail for 23 years. He works shifts and each shift normally lasts for 8 hours. Just to the East of the signal box is a branch line to Boston. The trains which run on the line carry both passengers and freight. The freight trains transport oil, coal, beer, cars and steel. About 50 trains pass along the line each day. There are two level crossings in the D block, one at the signal box where the road running North from the A.52. crosses the line and continues North to Vale Farm. The other is in the N.West of the D block where the Viking Way crosses the railway line.
